messages.title: A proud record of fighting for local people
messages.content: First elected in 1992, Glenda Jackson has held four drop-in surgeries per month in the constituency, run monthly coffee evenings on national policy, helped over 15,000 local people, and visited 22 local schools in the last year. Labour to her core, she will not be bullied and has stood up to the Government when it was right to do so, voting against the Iraq war, for 48 days' detention, and for better Gurkha pensions.

messages.title: Beating the Tories since 1992
messages.content: Glenda Jackson has been beating the Conservatives for 18 years. With your support, she can do it again.

messages.title: Britain is not broken
messages.content: "Our country has been through some tough times lately, but I think it's important to remember how far we've come," says Glenda Jackson.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Advocacy for Child Tax Credits & Child Trust Funds.
Support for the addition of 44,000 new doctors and 90,000 more nurses.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Winter fuel payments and free travel
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for winter fuel payments, free bus travel and eye tests for pensioners.
Support for the doubling of maternity leave.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for any other party risks letting the Tories in.

issues.economy: "Now we face the task of securing our fragile economic recovery, and I am confident Gordon Brown is the right man to take us through this time. Labour will continue to invest in is our greatest national resourceâ€”our people. We will protect the services we all rely on, continue to rebuild the economy and create the new green jobs of the future. Your vote is precious, please use it."
issues.environment: Create new green jobs of the future.

quotes.text: I was having a nightmare time dealing with the benefits agency. Glenda sorted it all out so I got what I was due, all in one day.
I needed help arranging care for my autistic daughter. Glenda was a great help and very supportive throughout.
